dt: {bc}marked by elaborate rhetoric {dx_def}see {dxt|rhetoric||2b}{/dx_def} or florid {dx_def}see {dxt|florid||1a}{/dx_def} style

dt.t: is clear and simple rather than {wi}ornate{/wi} and pompous

et: Middle English {it}ornat{/it}, from Latin {it}ornatus{/it}, past participle of {it}ornare{/it} to furnish, embellish; akin to Latin {it}ordo{/it} order {ma}{mat|order|}{/ma}
shortdef: marked by elaborate rhetoric or florid style
